title: 112_hr5709
content: The "Hospital Price Transparency and Disclosure Act of 2011" requires public disclosure of hospital data, including data reporting by hospitals and ambulatory surgical centers for public posting. The "Hospital Price Transparency and Disclosure Act of 2011" mandates hospitals and ambulatory surgical centers to report data to the Secretary every semiannual period regarding treatment episodes provided in inpatient or outpatient settings. The Act requires hospitals and ambulatory surgical centers to report data on treatment episodes, including total number of episodes, average charges for insured and uninsured individuals, and frequency of occurrence for ambulatory surgical centers. During each treatment episode, ambulatory surgical centers must report the total number of episodes, average charges for insured and uninsured individuals, and frequency of occurrence. The Secretary will post data on the official website for charge comparison among hospitals and ambulatory surgical centers. Hospitals and centers must notify patients of the data availability. The Secretary will identify treatment episodes for the 25 most frequently treated conditions in hospital inpatient, outpatient, and ambulatory surgical center settings. The Secretary may enter into an agreement with the Institute of Medicine to define treatment episodes for selected conditions. The Secretary will periodically update the selected conditions. A civil money penalty of up to $10,000 may be imposed for violations by hospitals or ambulatory surgical centers. Administrative provisions will be prescribed by the Secretary. The Secretary will prescribe regulations and guidelines for classifying treatment episodes and computing insured individual average charges for hospitals and ambulatory surgical centers. The regulations will determine cost-sharing amounts negotiated by hospitals or surgical centers with top insurance providers for treatment episodes. The providers must have negotiated rates and their enrollees must be involved. The regulations will determine cost-sharing amounts negotiated by hospitals or surgical centers with top insurance providers for treatment episodes. Enrollees with the highest number of patients must be involved in the computation of uninsured individual average charges for treatment episodes. The regulations specify how hospitals and ambulatory surgical centers report data on uninsured individuals receiving care. State laws regarding disclosure are not preempted by this section. The section does not regulate hospital or ambulatory surgical center charges, and defines these terms as per the Secretary's definition.
